Class codegen.CodeGen 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----codegen.CodeGen
public class CodeGen
extends Object
This class provides a simple interface to other parts of pest. path is a path name to a directory, where CodeGen will store its files. If an error occures, we will throw a CodeGenException.
Status Most of the code is implemented. Non-determinism is not handled correctly yet.
To Do
  • Need to fix code for non-determinism.
  • Default connectors currently do not work.
Known Bugs
  • No Bugs nown. But see Prerequisites.
swtech25
Prerequisites:
  • We expect the Statechart to be a complete, executable and correct state chart. We will not announce an error, but instead create incorrect code (as far as it is possible to talk about incorrect code).
  • All identifiers should not contain ".". Perhaps we might fix this problem someday. Currently we expect all identifiers to be valid Java identifiers.
  • The pathname is assumed to be a fully qualified path to an existing directory without trailing "/".
Assertions:
  • none.

Version:
$Id: CodeGen.java,v 1.16 1999/01/25 14:22:18 swtech25 Exp $
Author:
Marcel Kyas, Walter Loeser, Andre Paetzold.

CodeGen(String, Statechart)
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work.
CodeGen(String, Statechart, int)
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work.

Generate(String, Statechart)
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator.
Generate(String, Statechart, CodeGenOpt)
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator.

CodeGen 
 public CodeGen(String path,
                Statechart statechart) throws CodeGenException
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work. It will return after successful completion.

Throws: CodeGenException
if code generation fails.
CodeGen 
 public CodeGen(String path,
                Statechart statechart,
                int options) throws CodeGenException
This method will cause the CodeGenerator to do its work. It will return after successful completion. This will activate some options.

Throws: CodeGenException
if code generation fails.

Generate 
 public void Generate(String path,
                      Statechart statechart) throws CodeGenException
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator.

Throws: CodeGenException
if code generation fails.
Generate 
 public void Generate(String path,
                      Statechart statechart,
                      CodeGenOpt o) throws CodeGenException
This method is an alternative to produce code, if you do not want to create a new instance of the code generator. This time with options. Options are currently ignored.

Throws: CodeGenException
if code generation fails.
